macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stock Markets Mixed on First Trading Day of 2026
items.summary: The S&P 500 rose to 6864 points, gaining 0.27% on January 2, while the Dow gained over 100 points or 0.17%. Nasdaq 100 was slightly lower amid mixed sector performance, with AI and chip stocks leading gains after a late 2025 slump.

items.title: AI Sector Drives New Year's Rally in US Stocks
items.summary: Major indexes rose on tech strength, particularly AI shares, after four losing sessions in 2025; Nasdaq gained over 1% early, supported by Baidu's AI unit IPO filing and chip stock advances. S&P 500 at 6,845.50 (-0.74% intraday), Dow at 48,063 (-0.63%).

items.title: Quiet Holiday Weekend for Markets on January 3
items.summary: Global markets closed with no major economic data or corporate earnings; low liquidity expected, investors eye ISM Manufacturing Index next week and Non-Farm Payrolls on January 9 ahead of earnings season.

items.title: Bitcoin and Crypto Stocks Rise Early in 2026
items.summary: Bitcoin up over 2% testing $90,000, with associated stocks climbing about 2%; reflects positive start after 2025 decline.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Rises to $90,000 Level on Second Day of 2026
items.summary: Major cryptocurrencies including Bitcoin, Ether, and XRP moved higher as 2026 began, with Bitcoin reaching the $90,000 level. Both Bitcoin and Ether were in the green for the week.

items.title: January 15 Marked as Critical Date for Crypto Regulatory Clarity
items.summary: January 15, 2026 is expected to be a significant day for cryptocurrency, with votes on the Clarity Act and potential changes to MSCI index inclusion for crypto companies. Additional regulatory developments including tariffs and potential government shutdown are also anticipated in January.

items.title: Ethereum Tokenization and 2026 Outlook
items.summary: Bit Digital CEO Sam Tabar discussed expectations for the Ethereum network in 2026, highlighting the rapid increase in major financial institutions' involvement in asset tokenization built on Ethereum.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Anthem Servers to Shut Down Permanently on January 12, 2026
items.summary: BioWare and EA's Anthem will have its servers shut down on January 12, 2026, making the online-only game unplayable across all platforms. Other Xbox titles Warlander (January 20) and NBA Live 19 (January 30) are also closing servers this month.

items.title: Major Game Releases Announced for January 2026 Including Pathologic 3 and Animal Crossing Switch 2 Edition
items.summary: January 2026 features key releases like Pathologic 3 on January 9 (psychological horror by Ice-Pick Lodge), Animal Crossing: New Horizons Switch 2 Edition on January 15, Dynasty Warriors: Origins on Switch 2 on January 22, and The Seven Deadly Sins: Origin on January 28.

items.title: PlayStation Plus Free Games for January 2026 Revealed
items.summary: PS Plus Extra and Premium subscribers can claim Need for Speed Unbound, Disney Epic Mickey: Rebrushed, and Core Keeper starting January 6, 2026. Additional free titles include Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 and others via various services.

items.title: Xbox News Highlights Elder Scrolls 6 Speculation and Price Increases
items.summary: Recent Xbox updates discuss Elder Scrolls 6 developments, price hikes, and next-gen Xbox pricing based on survey data, amid ongoing industry conversations.

items.title: Generative AI Sparks Debate in Gaming Industry Entering 2026
items.summary: As 2026 begins, generative AI remains a divisive topic, fueling conflicts among developers, publishers, artists, and players in the gaming sector.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Stocks Open 2026 Strongly Driven by Tech Sector Gains
items.summary: Global stocks started 2026 on an upbeat note with technology stocks, particularly chips and internet firms, leading advances; Samsung Electronics hit an all-time high while Baidu's chip unit filed for IPO.

items.title: BYD Surpasses Tesla as World's Largest EV Maker in 2025
items.summary: BYD met its full-year sales target and likely overtook Tesla to become the top electric vehicle producer globally in 2025, amid Tesla's expected Q4 delivery drop to 440,900 units.

items.title: New Wave of Tech Regulations Takes Effect in 2026 Across US States
items.summary: Multiple US states including California, Colorado, Texas, and New York implement new laws on data privacy, AI safety disclosures, deepfakes, and algorithmic discrimination starting January 1, 2026.

items.title: CES 2026 Preview Highlights Keynotes from AMD, Siemens and Industry Trends
items.summary: CES 2026 kicks off January 6 in Las Vegas with keynotes from AMD CEO Lisa Su and Siemens CEO Roland Busch, focusing on next-gen diagnostics, quantum computing in health, and smart wearables.
